name: 0002: Help
expected:
usage: lngs [-h] [--version] [--share <dir>] <command> <source> -o <file> [<arguments>]

optional arguments:
 -h, --help    shows this help message and exits
 -v, --version shows program version and exits
 --share <dir> replaces $SHARE as new data directory

known commands:
 make          Translates PO/MO file to LNG file.
 pot           Creates POT file from message file.
 enums         Creates header file from message file.
 py            Creates Python module with string keys.
 res           Creates C++ file with fallback resource for the message file.
 freeze        Reads the language description file and assigns values to new strings.

The flow for string management and creation:

1. Developer (adding new string):
   > vim .idl
   > git commit .idl
2. Developer (compiling existing list):
   > lngs enums
   > lngs res
   > git commit .hpp .cpp
3. Translation Manager:
   > msgfmt [optional]
   > lngs enums
   > lngs res
   > lngs make
   > git commit .hpp .cpp [optional]
4. Translator:
   > msgmerge (or msginit)
   > e.g. poedit .po
   > git commit .po
5. Developer (releasing a build):
   > msgfmt (opt)
   > lngs make
   > tar -c
